edu.frontrange.csc240.util

Class InputData

  • Object
    • edu.frontrange.csc240.util.InputData
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AutoCloseable, Iterable<String[]>

    public final class InputData
extends Object
implements Iterable<String[]>, AutoCloseable
    Class to input lines of values from a given file or resource.

    Given the name of the file or resource from which to input lines of values, the values on the lines are found delimited by a given regular expressions, and returned in an array of String values.

    An iterator is defined to iterate over the lines. Each line of the file is returned in the form of an array of Strings. Example of such a file is a "csv" (comma-separated-value) file. End-on-line is always treated as an acceptable delimiter.

    The content of the files is as defined for Java sources files, allowing Unicode escapes. Further, if enabled, a character escaped with reverse slash is returned "as-is" (and cannot be recognized as being part of a delimiting sequence), and if a line separator is immediately preceded by a reverse slash, then that line separator is ignored (including any following white space). This processing is enabled by default.

    Blank lines are ignored, as are, if enabled, comments introduced by the defined characters terminated by an line separator (or end-of-file). By default, this is enabled, and the comment character is "#". (Use null to disable comment processing).

    End-of-line may be any of the Unicode characters carriage return, line feed, carriage return followed by line feed, vertical tab, form feed, next line (0x85), line separator (0x2028), or paragraph separator (0x2029).

    © 2013 Paladin Software International, Incorporated.

    Since:
    1.8
    Version:
    1.1, 2016-08-22
    Author:
    Dr. Bruce K. Haddon, Paladin Software International Incorporated

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      private class  InputData.InputIterator<T>
      The class implementing the iterator over the lines, where for each line of the input is returned in the form of an array of Strings, where each String represents a delimited substring of each line from the file.

    • Constructor Detail

      • InputData

        public InputData(String name,
                 Class<?> location,
                 String encoding,
                 int limit,
                 String... regex)
          throws NullPointerException,
                 java.nio.charset.IllegalCharsetNameException,
                 java.nio.charset.UnsupportedCharsetException,
                 IllegalArgumentException
        Constructor. Initializes an instance for input from the given file or resource.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of a file or resource from which to read
        location - a class name if the name is of a resource, otherwise null. If the name is of a resource, then the name should follow the rules of getResourceAsStream of class Class. Otherwise, the name should follow the rules of the class File
        encoding - the name of the expected encoding of the resource or file. If null, then "ISO-8859-1" (Latin-1) is assumed
        limit - number of expected values per line of input (or zero if this is not to be checked)
        regex - array of regular expressions defining the expected delimiters (in order) within the line (spaces around values will be ignored and removed). If the list is used completely, matching starts over again with the first delimiter
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the given name of file or resource is null
        java.nio.charset.IllegalCharsetNameException - if the given encoding name is illegal
        java.nio.charset.UnsupportedCharsetException - if no support for the named encoding is available in this instance of the Java virtual machine
        IllegalArgumentException - if the file or resource with given name cannot be found

      • InputData

        public InputData(java.io.InputStream in,
                 String encoding,
                 int limit,
                 String... regex)
        Constructor. Initializes an instance for input from the given InputStream.
        Parameters:
        in - an InputStream from which to read
        encoding - the name of the expected encoding of the resource or file. If null, then "ISO-8859-1" (Latin-1) is assumed
        limit - number of expected values per line of input (or zero if this is not to be checked)
        regex - array of regular expressions defining the expected delimiters (in order) within the line (spaces around values will be ignored and removed). If the list is used completely, matching starts over again with the first delimiter
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the given InputStream is null
        java.nio.charset.IllegalCharsetNameException - if the given encoding name is illegal
        java.nio.charset.UnsupportedCharsetException - if no support for the named encoding is available in this instance of the Java virtual machine

    • Method Detail

      • close

        public void close()
        Close the InputData class (and the classes it is using)
        Specified by:
        close in interface AutoCloseable

      • enableComments

        public String enableComments(String commentSequence)
                      throws IllegalArgumentException
        Enable the processing of comments in the input. Comments may be introduced by a designated sequence of characters, and that sequence, including all characters to the following end of line, are ignored.

        An empty or null commentSequence will disable any comment processing.

        The comment sequence, if escapes are enabled, may not contain an escape sequence.

        Parameters:
        commentSequence - the comment sequence to be set
        Returns:
        the previous commentSequence
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if escapes are enabled, and the suggested comment sequence contains the escape character.

      • enableEscapes

        public boolean enableEscapes(boolean escapesEnabled)
        Enable the processing of escape characters in the input. Any character following the reverse slash escape character is transmitted without change (and will not be recognized as a matching character for any regular expression that may be being used to identify delimiters. Note that Unicode escape processing is not turned off by this control—Unicode escapes are always processed.
        Parameters:
        escapesEnabled - the escape state to set (true to enable)
        Returns:
        the previous state

      • iterator

        public java.util.Iterator<String[]> iterator()
        Return an iterator for the InputData class. This iterator provides two methods: one to test whether there is another line available, and another that returns each line of the input in the form of an array of Strings, where each String represents a delimited and trimmed substring from each line from the file.
        Specified by:
        iterator in interface Iterable<String[]>
        Returns:
        the iterator that sequences through the lines of the file

      • spliterator

        public java.util.Spliterator<String[]> spliterator()
        Returns a spliterator for the InputData class. This spliterator is sequential (not CONCURRENT), immutable, and does not return null elements (NONNULL). It cannot be split.
        Specified by:
        spliterator in interface Iterable<String[]>
        Returns:
        the spliterator that sequences through the lines of the file

        public java.util.stream.Stream<String[]> stream()

        Returns:
        the stream

      • inputStream

        private static java.io.InputStream inputStream(String name,
                                               Class<?> location)
        Method to obtain an InputStream given a name and a possible location of a resource by that name. If no location is given, then the name is taken to be a file name.
        Parameters:
        name - resource or file name
        location - if a resource, the locating class, otherwise null for a file
        Returns:
        an InputStream
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if a resource or file of that name cannot be found.
